serinfo.sername: Phase 3 EPCA Section 604 Crude Oil, Natural Gas, and Natural gas liquids proved reserves data collection, reduction, analysis and presentation

citeinfo.origin: US Depts of the Interior, Agriculture & Energy
citeinfo.title: Phase 3 EPCA Section 604 Crude Oil, Natural Gas, and Natural gas liquids proved reserves data collection, reduction, analysis and presentation

descript.abstract: Gross Oil and Gas Field outlines from the Williston Basin, with the following attributes: field name, classes of proven gross 2004 liquids, gas & BOE reserves, state (ND, SD or MT), DOE field code, fraction of each field in the basin outline, fraction of each field outline that is federal land.
descript.supplinf: Process_Description: Build oil & gas field outline polygons by buffering each well in a field and unioning the buffers. 1. Start with point file of oil & gas wells (producing wells only, no dry holes or injectors) with field name attribute "Field" and reservoir name "reservoir". Sources of wells are ND Industrial Commission- Dept of Mineral Resources/ Oil & Gas Division, SD Dept. of Environment & Natural Resouces- Minerals & Mining Program/Oil & Gas Section, MT Board of Oil & Gas, EIA's USPS database and vendor HPDI. Decimate data to only include wells located in the study areas/basins. Bottom hole location (BHL) data was available for all MT and ND directional/horizontal wells and most SD horizontal wells and were used. 2. In SAS, estimate the BHL well spacing for each reservoir in each field. See appendix of report for detailed methodology. For each well, populate the column "Buffer" with the desired buffer radius (ft). 3a. In ArcGIS, write VBA script to build gross field outline polygons. Do the following in batch mode for Surface locations (SL) of vertical wells and BHL's of directional wells (latter identified in ND only): -Select "field name" attribute & buffer "distance attribute" from point (well) file. -Select all wells with first "field name" encountered. -Create buffer around each selected well using "buffer distance". -Union buffers and dissolve barriers between overlapping buffers. -Loop through point file and perform for each "field name". 3b. For each horizontal well, build a line between BHL and SL and apply the calculated buffer to that line. Union this buffer file to the buffer of step 3a, dissolving on attribute "field". -Perform a smoothing operation on the resultant polyon file to eliminate small internal "islands" and the scalloped appearance on the outside of outlines (See report appendix for details) to get smoothed gross field polygons. 4. Clip gross field polygons with the study area outline to remove portions of fields that extend outside of study area outlines. Calculate value of attribute "FRC_INBASIN" (fraction in-basin) = (field area after clipping/field area before clipping). Value of this is = 1 for fields that do not extend out of study area. One -well fields that extend outside of the study area are given FRC_INBASIN = 1. 5. Calculate % of Federal land within each field outline polygon. Use federal land layer provided to EIA by BLM contractor ARI (one layer/study area). "Federal land" for this study is defined as federal ownership of the surface, mineral rights or both. 6. Intersect federal land layers (from ARI) with gross field outlines to get federal field outlines. 7. Join reserve class codes to the shapfile by field name.

cntperp.cntorg: Z, Inc (contractor to Energy Information Administration)

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 3; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.2.4.1420

altsys.altenc: Explicit elevation coordinate included with horizontal coordinates

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Area of feature in internal units squared.

edom.edomv: Class for ranges of Federal oil+gas reservesin BOE units (Thousands of barrels of oil equivalent =MBOE)

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Fraction of federal land within field outline (federal land area of field/ total field area; range 0-1)

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: 2004 proved liquid reserves class: If liquids reserves (LR) =0 MBL then LIQRES_CL=0; if LR > 0 MBL and LR </= 10 MBL then LIQRES_CL=1; if LR > 10 MBL and LR </= 100 MBL then LIQRES_CL=2; if LR > 100 MBL and LR </= 1000 MBL then LIQRES_CL=3; if LR > 1000 MBL and LR </= 10,000 MBL then LIQRES_CL=4; if LR > 10,000 MBL and LR </= 100,000 MBL then LIQRES_CL=5

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: 2004 proved BOE reserves class: If BOE reserves (BR) =0 MBOE then OERES_CL=0; if BR > 0 MBOE and BR </= 10 MBOE then BOERES_CL=1; if BR > 10 MBOE and BR </= 100 MBOE then BOERES_CL=2; if BR > 100 MBOE and BR </= 1000 MBOE then BOERES_CL=3; if BR > 1000 MBOE and BR </= 10,000 MBOE then BOERES_CL=4; if BR > 10,000 MBOE and BR </= 100,000 MBOE then BOERES_CL=5; if BR > 100,000 MBOE then BOERES_CL=6

2004 proved gas reserve class: If gas reserves(GR) =0 MMCFG then GASRES_CL=0; if GR > 0 MMCFG and GR </= 10 MMCFG then GASRES_CL=1; if GR > 10 MMCFG and GR </= 100 MMCFG then GASRES_CL=2; if GR > 100 MMCFG and GR </= 1000 MMCFG then GASRES_CL=3; if GR > 1000 MMCFG and GR </= 10,000 MMCFG then GASRES_CL=4; if GR > 10,000 MMCFG and GR </= 100,000 MMCFG then GASRES_CL=5; if GR > 100,000 MMCFG then GASRES_CL=6

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standards for Digital Geospatial Metadata

lineage.Process: FeatureClassToFeatureClass C:\MyDocs\EPCA-3\Turn-Ins\EPCA-3_Finals.mdb\Williston_Gross C:\MyDocs\EPCA-3\Maps_for_website\shps_for_website WillistonBasin.shp # "field field true true false 30 Text 0 0 ,First,#,C:\MyDocs\EPCA-3\Turn-Ins\EPCA-3_Finals.mdb\Williston_Gross,field,-1,-1;FLDCD_DOE FLDCD_DOE true true false 4 Long 0 0 ,First,#,C:\MyDocs\EPCA-3\Turn-Ins\EPCA-3_Finals.mdb\Williston_Gross,FLDCD_DOE,-1,-1;PctFedLand PctFedLand true true false 8 Double 0 0 ,First,#,C:\MyDocs\EPCA-3\Turn-Ins\EPCA-3_Finals.mdb\Williston_Gross,PctFedLand,-1,-1;FRC_INBASI FRC_INBASI true true false 8 Double 0 0 ,First,#,C:\MyDocs\EPCA-3\Turn-Ins\EPCA-3_Finals.mdb\Williston_Gross,FRC_INBASIN,-1,-1;basin basin true true false 30 Text 0 0 ,First,#,C:\MyDocs\EPCA-3\Turn-Ins\EPCA-3_Finals.mdb\Williston_Gross,basin,-1,-1;state state true true false 2 Text 0 0 ,First,#,C:\MyDocs\EPCA-3\Turn-Ins\EPCA-3_Finals.mdb\Williston_Gross,state,-1,-1;LIQRES_CLA LIQRES_CLA true true false 4 Long 0 0 ,First,#,C:\MyDocs\EPCA-3\Turn-Ins\EPCA-3_Finals.mdb\Williston_Gross,LIQRES_CLA,-1,-1;GASRES_CLA GASRES_CLA true true false 8 Double 0 0 ,First,#,C:\MyDocs\EPCA-3\Turn-Ins\EPCA-3_Finals.mdb\Williston_Gross,GASRES_CLA,-1,-1;BOERES_CLA BOERES_CLA true true false 8 Double 0 0 ,First,#,C:\MyDocs\EPCA-3\Turn-Ins\EPCA-3_Finals.mdb\Williston_Gross,BOERES_CLA,-1,-1;Shape_Leng Shape_Length false true true 8 Double 0 0 ,First,#,C:\MyDocs\EPCA-3\Turn-Ins\EPCA-3_Finals.mdb\Williston_Gross,Shape_Length,-1,-1;Shape_Area Shape_Area false true true 8 Double 0 0 ,First,#,C:\MyDocs\EPCA-3\Turn-Ins\EPCA-3_Finals.mdb\Williston_Gross,Shape_Area,-1,-1" # C:\MyDocs\EPCA-3\Maps_for_website\shps_for_website\WillistonBasin.shp
